突.definition: to dash; to move forward quickly; to bulge; to protrude; to break through; to rush out; sudden; Taiwan pr. [tu2]

突兀.definition: lofty or towering; sudden or abrupt

突出.definition: prominent; outstanding; to give prominence to; to protrude; to project

突厥.definition: Turkic people, who lived across the Eurasian continent; (esp.) the Göktürks of medieval Inner Asia

突圍.definition: to break a siege; to break out of an enclosure

突如其來.definition: to arise abruptly; to arrive suddenly; happening suddenly

突擊.definition: sudden and violent attack; assault; fig. rushed job; concentrated effort to finish a job quickly

突擊檢查.definition: sudden unannounced investigation; on-the-spot inspection; to search without notification

突泉縣.definition: Tuquan county in Hinggan league 興安盟|兴安盟[Xing1 an1 meng2], east Inner Mongolia

突發奇想.definition: suddenly have a thought (idiom); suddenly be inspired to do something

突破.definition: to break through; to make a breakthrough; to surmount (an obstacle); (sports) to break through the opponent's defense

突突.definition: (onom.) beating of the heart; pitapat; pulsation of a machine

突襲.definition: to raid; to storm; surprise attack

突起.definition: to appear suddenly; projection; bit sticking out

突顯.definition: conspicuous; to make sth stand out; make sth prominent

突飛猛進.definition: to advance by leaps and bounds
